name: GDPR
governingBody: European Parliament and Council of the European Union
primaryAudience: Any Organization Processing EU Personal Data
description: The GDPR enforces rigorous data privacy laws across the EU, applying extraterritorially to any global organization processing personal data of EU residents. It champions 'Privacy by Design and by Default,' mandating that data protection is integrated into software from inception. It uses a risk-based approach rather than prescriptive technology mandates.

certificationDetails.assessor: Self-assessment; enforced by national Data Protection Authorities (DPAs)
certificationDetails.auditCycle: Ongoing compliance; DPA investigations are complaint-driven
certificationDetails.certificationBody: National Data Protection Authorities (e.g., ICO, CNIL, BfDI)

lifecycle.name: Data Mapping & Inventory
lifecycle.description: Map all personal data processing activities. Create Record of Processing Activities (RoPA).

lifecycle.name: Gap Analysis & Risk Assessment
lifecycle.description: Assess current practices against GDPR requirements. Conduct DPIAs for high-risk processing.

lifecycle.name: Implementation of TOMs
lifecycle.description: Implement Technical and Organizational Measures. Deploy Privacy by Design controls.

lifecycle.name: Ongoing Compliance
lifecycle.description: Maintain compliance through continuous monitoring, training, and documentation.

domains.name: Data Processing Principles (Articles 5-11)
domains.description: Foundational principles governing how personal data must be processed.

controls.name: Lawfulness, Fairness, and Transparency
controls.description: Personal data shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject.
controls.implementationGuidance: Document lawful basis for each processing activity. Provide clear privacy notices. Ensure transparency in all data collection.

controls.name: Purpose Limitation
controls.description: Data shall be collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner incompatible with those purposes.
controls.implementationGuidance: Document purpose for each data collection. Prevent function creep. Implement technical controls to restrict data use to stated purposes.

controls.name: Data Minimization
controls.description: Data shall be adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed.
controls.implementationGuidance: Audit data collection forms. Remove unnecessary fields. Validate that only essential data is collected in APIs.

controls.name: Accuracy
controls.description: Data shall be accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement data quality checks. Provide self-service profile updates. Validate data inputs.

controls.name: Storage Limitation
controls.description: Data shall be kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define retention periods per data category. Implement automated deletion. Archive or anonymize data past retention period.

controls.name: Integrity and Confidentiality
controls.description: Data shall be processed with appropriate security measures, including protection against unauthorized or unlawful processing and against accidental loss.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement encryption at rest and in transit. Deploy access controls. Conduct regular security assessments.

controls.name: Accountability
controls.description: The controller shall be responsible for and able to demonstrate compliance with the data processing principles.
controls.implementationGuidance: Maintain comprehensive documentation. Conduct regular audits. Appoint DPO where required. Demonstrate compliance proactively.

domains.name: Data Subject Rights (Articles 12-23)
domains.description: Rights granted to individuals whose personal data is processed.

controls.name: Right of Access
controls.description: Data subjects have the right to obtain confirmation of processing and access to their personal data.
controls.implementationGuidance: Build data export functionality. Implement DSAR workflow. Respond within 30 days. Verify requester identity.

controls.name: Right to Rectification
controls.description: Data subjects have the right to have inaccurate personal data rectified.
controls.implementationGuidance: Provide self-service data editing. Process rectification requests within 30 days. Notify third parties of corrections.

controls.name: Right to Erasure (Right to be Forgotten)
controls.description: Data subjects have the right to have their personal data erased under certain conditions.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement data deletion workflows. Handle cascading deletes across systems. Document legal grounds for retention when erasure is refused.

controls.name: Right to Data Portability
controls.description: Data subjects have the right to receive their personal data in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format.
controls.implementationGuidance: Build data export in JSON/CSV. Provide API for machine-readable data transfer. Ensure interoperability.

domains.name: Security of Processing - TOMs (Article 32)
domains.description: Technical and Organizational Measures required to ensure appropriate security of personal data.

controls.name: Pseudonymization and Encryption
controls.description: Implement pseudonymization and encryption of personal data to minimize breach impact.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement AES-256 encryption at rest. Enforce TLS 1.2+ in transit. Use pseudonymization for analytics data. Tokenize PII where possible.

controls.name: Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability, Resilience
controls.description: Ensure the ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of processing systems and services.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement MFA, RBAC, and strict password policies. Deploy across multiple availability zones. Implement DDoS protection.

controls.name: Restore Availability and Access
controls.description: Implement ability to restore the availability and access to personal data in a timely manner in the event of a physical or technical incident.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement backup and disaster recovery. Define RTO/RPO. Test restoration procedures regularly. Deploy multi-region backup.

controls.name: Regular Testing and Assessment
controls.description: Implement a process for regularly testing, assessing and evaluating the effectiveness of technical and organizational measures.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct quarterly vulnerability scans. Perform annual penetration testing. Review security controls effectiveness. Implement continuous monitoring.

controls.name: Protective Software and Threat Detection
controls.description: Deploy advanced antivirus, antimalware, and real-time threat detection tools.
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy EDR on all endpoints. Enable real-time threat detection. Implement SIEM for centralized monitoring.

domains.name: Breach Notification (Articles 33-34)
domains.description: Requirements for notifying authorities and data subjects of personal data breaches.

controls.name: Notification to Supervisory Authority
controls.description: In case of a personal data breach, the controller shall notify the competent supervisory authority within 72 hours of becoming aware of it.
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop breach notification procedures. Define 72-hour notification workflow. Prepare template notifications. Establish breach assessment criteria.

controls.name: Communication to Data Subject
controls.description: When the personal data breach is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall communicate the breach to the data subject without undue delay.
controls.implementationGuidance: Prepare data subject notification templates. Define high-risk assessment criteria. Implement mass notification capability.

domains.name: International Data Transfers (Chapter V)
domains.description: Requirements for transferring personal data outside the EU/EEA.

controls.name: Transfer Mechanisms
controls.description: Transfers of personal data to third countries shall only take place if appropriate safeguards are provided.
controls.implementationGuidance: Use Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) or adequacy decisions. Conduct Transfer Impact Assessments (TIAs). Document data transfer mechanisms.
evidenceRequired: Data flow maps showing cross-border transfers

controls.name: Data Processing Agreements
controls.description: Processing by a processor shall be governed by a contract or legal act that sets out the subject-matter, duration, nature, and purpose of the processing.
controls.implementationGuidance: Execute DPAs with all data processors. Include sub-processor requirements. Define security obligations. Require breach notification.

breachNotification.timeframe: 72 hours to supervisory authority; without undue delay to data subjects
breachNotification.threshold: When breach likely results in high risk to rights and freedoms of individuals
